intro: Clerodendrum obtusidens, commonly known as the broad-leaved flame bush, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant has opposite, ovate to elliptical leaves that are usually dark green and glossy. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and ability to thrive in warm climates. Clerodendrum obtusidens is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
